Posts.Content: Hello everyone I have heard of an existence of a medication which has been launched in usa and not in europe, which is very effective against cancer. Can you tell me what it is?
Posts.Title: prostate cancer with metastasis to bones - most effective drug

Posts.Content: Thank you for a warm welcome. It is about my girlfriend's father, 70. I will ask her to give me more details. I see Radium-223 drug was developed by the Norwegians and Bayer, so it is probably not this one. However, I should know about the drug I originally referred and will get back to tell you.
Posts.Title: prostate cancer with metastasis to bones - most effective drug

Posts.Content: Hello Thank you for sharing. We are looking for the best option for my father. Every information could be useful.Thank you again. Wish you good health and long life. Maja & Tom
Posts.Title: Painkillers at cancer.

Posts.Content: Greetings everyone. I would like to know your opinion about painkillers at cancer( cancer of prostate with metastasis to bones). I've heard about painkiller plasters Durogesic, but I've also heard than it can be a reason of hallucinations. Can you recommend any better ones available on the Polish or English market? Please share your experiences. Many thanks and all the best. Tom and Maja
Posts.Title: Painkillers at cancer.

Posts.Content: Hello My partner's father has been suffering from prostate cancer for two years now with metastasis to the bones diagnosed suspected 2 years ago and confirmed several months ago. Ever since father fell ill his condition had been deteriorating slowly, until a recent operation of drilling in his bone to collect a sample of medulla. Now, it has got much worse in a very short period of time. Could drilling in the bone have made his condition get worse? If yes, what is the mechanism? Thank you. Tom
Posts.Title: Could taking a medulla sample have made things much worse?

Posts.Content: Hi Chuck Thanks for a warm welcome. Yes, we are going to get father have a medical diagnosis. Just checking the variety of options. Looking forward to some suggestions. Best wishes T&M
Posts.Title: Painkillers at cancer.
